title: Adding spice to league of legends.
body: Soo I'm gonna go straight to it, I realise that riot won't add anyone's actual concept champion to league for what I'd expect to be a number of reasons, however I'm unaware if they will use ability ideas (sorry if you do not understand, my apologies). So I've put thought into what I'd like to see in the future with league, and realise there isn't any champion who uses terrain as a means of attack (I know there are a few champions that actually do, but not in the way I'm talking about) I'm yet to experience a champion who attacks from the walls, and terrain, like some kind of a swift swordsmen who dashes to and then jumps off the wall sweeping there blade('s) in a wide area, or a ranged champion who uses proximity mines attached to walls, or one of those classic traps as you trip a wire and the steaks come flying around the corner, impaling the victim, I'm somewhat tired of seeing the normal abilities and traps that sit on the ground in what is practically becoming foreseeable, it's become boring with the usual "dodge attacks from the front" the current traps, and other abilities that that you can place are traditionally places in the middle of paths to "surprise" people, I feel like league has since lost it's touch with keeping people on edge, but if the danger could be somewhat spread out, meaning that you have to watch out for attacks from the wall, rather than just getting ganked by the jungle, I loved Vel, he was an epic addition to the game that made it so you had to be more aware of where attacks were coming from rather then just what was ahead of you, I'd like peoples thoughts on this, and if riot you haven't added something like this for a specific reason, please tell me why you haven't explored this seemingly very viable option to make new champs, also with the changes in season 6, I imagine people will start warding more often, and personally I feel like creating someone like this will be worth it due to changes in season 6. Thank you for reading.

replies.body:
If you had've posted this in Season 3 most people would agree. This season is totally different though, you actually cannot argue about champion creativity in Season 6. The most boring champion released this year was probably Ekko. Everyone else is really unique.

{{champion:203}} **Kindred**  - Most unique Ult in the game, and exploring a new side of ADC junglers. Super innovative and fun to play.

{{champion:223}} **Tahm Kench** - Seems simple at first but he actually has some pretty innovative abilities like W and E. His ult is epic as well because it can bring slow tanks to areas in fight where they usually would get peeled off.

{{champion:432}} **Bard** - This guy was a silent step in the right direction for a new role; The Roamer. Sadly they didn't buff this side of him, but he's still good. He's probably got the most versatile ult in the game, and his E and W leave a lot of space for different play-styles.

Just because they didn't use your ideas doesn't mean they're not innovative or ignoring player concepts. In fact, Bard and Kindred were both community inspired.

I have lots of ideas, though I only thought to post anything yesterday, and I searched if riot would ever use someone's idea, and the answer came up as most likely not, but what I'm focusing on is the fact that when you play against a champion, you automatically know the damage and threat is right in front of you, I know that the recent champs have been crazy cool, but I see the terrain all around me in league and think how unique it would be if a champion used it for an ability.

Well, Vayne and Gnar do that already, along with Bard. Having a damaging wall sticking trap is hard to add into a game (what's the champion's lore, why does it only stick to walls, why does it matter?), and dashes that bounce off walls are useless in both junglers and in laners because most junglers want to jump over them and most laners don't want to have an ability that is hard to use in lane.

> [{quoted}](name=TeCoolMage,realm=OCE,application-id=hIjvqaz6,discussion-id=vHKuwE9J,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2015-11-04T09:53:21.796+0000)

Having a damaging wall sticking trap is hard to add into a game (what's the champion's lore, why does it only stick to walls, why does it matter?), and dashes that bounce off walls are useless in both junglers and in laners because most junglers want to jump over them and most laners don't want to have an ability that is hard to use in lane.

I guess we imagine different things when this is brought up. Also this isn't a champion, I'm saying I just want to see more champs use the terrain of the jungle and such. For the whole blade jumpy thingy off wall, I imagined some champions ultimate just jumping from wall to wall slicing enemies up, think of a large scale yi alpha only it doesn't target people, just quickly dashing through enemy's. Ir doesn't really matter about anything I can specifically think of, it's just that it is somewhat boring seeing all this random stuff laying on the ground and people being pushed into walls, rather then coming off them. Anyway, that's just what I feel about the abilities in league, they all feel the same in a way.
